result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Anna Kees
Hearing on April 5, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:18 AM Defendant Nicole E Klug in court.  Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court calls the matter for Status of Counsel.
The Court goes over the procedural history of the case.
The Defendant presents statements as to getting an attorney.
The Court orders the Defendnat to go to SPD in waukesha right after court.
Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing and will adjourn.
THE COURT AUTHORIZES ZOOM FOR THE NEXT HEARING.  Hearing scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on March 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.

09:53 AM Defendant Nicole E Klug appeared by Zoom.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  The defendant is asking for additional time to seek counsel as she was just released from Jefferson County Jail.  The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  The defendant is to appear in person at the next date.  Hearing scheduled for March 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on March 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with Walmart listed in the Criminal Complaint.

01:54 PM Defendant Nicole E Klug in court, in custody.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant states she was not seen by the Public Defenders Office.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.   Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for March 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.
